intro: Schmidelia alnifolia, commonly known as the alderleaf schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring. Its leaves are elliptical and have a leathery texture, resembling those of alder trees, hence its common name. Schmidelia alnifolia thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
